posts.name: DW - [Bk] Mentor
posts.cooked: A machine with these specs costs $3,000 when priced at $11,000.

posts.name: Adam Fleming
posts.cooked: I’d imagine it means they are discontinuing the product. Their lower end machines are mostly rebadged from what I could tell. We have a horizontal bandsaw and it’s been okay, but has been a bear to keep running straight.

posts.name: Sean Lavery
posts.cooked: An overview of Baileigh Industrial's WR-32 Wood Router is available on YouTube featuring the video ID R828czPiW_o.

posts.name: Rod
posts.cooked: We've had a Baleigh router for years. It works fine. The spindle wasn't perfectly perpendicular to the table, but a thin layer of shim fixed that. I recall that the router's G-code doesn't support arcs; thus, they have to be approximated using linear segments. Yeah, it's an Asian-made router with their own branding. The router on our machine is a Weihong NK105G2. After the kids dropped it five million times, we had to replace its power cable.

posts.name: Rod
posts.cooked:
Extremely important! Do not output anything but the cleaned version (no introduction, no other little explanation), just the cleaned paragraph.

Unit has a separate brain cabinet; stand features sheet metal covers over a box tube frame. Considering removing covers for storage!

posts.name: philso
posts.cooked: They are selling a WR-32 unit that's in a scratch and dent condition for $7263, likely due to it being returned.

posts.name: sanddrag
posts.cooked: Baleigh stuff in general isn’t fantastic, though not terrible. For $3k I'd buy it, but I know there might be unexpected issues. For $11k I won't touch it.
